description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION AND A FRONT ENTRANCE PORCH.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: A102-1; A103-1;  A104-1; A105

Condition : 3 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in materials, style, colour, texture and, in the case of brickwork, bonding, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 4 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the double height window to stairwell the west elevation (shown in drawing A103-1) shall be glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut and shall permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

  i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE:
Proposed floor plans appear to show a house in multiple occupation. The applicant is reminded that should the occupancy exceed 6 individual persons, then planning consent must be sought in order to avoid any enforcement action.

Condition : 7 - The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE:
If you have an HMO with five or more people (includes adults and all children) you need to apply for a mandatory licence. More information can be found at: https://www.merton.gov.uk/council-tax-benefits-and-housing/private-housing/licensing-of-houses-in-multiple-occupation
